byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and ALEXANDER BURNS

abstract: Meeting of prominent black ministers, civil rights advocates and legislators reveals growing frustration with New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio; attendees voice disappointment about his lack of engagement with community, and his seemingly diminishing interest in affordable housing, criminal justice reform and other major issues; development represents risk for de Blasio, whose rise to mayoralty depended on strong support from blacks.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio remains popular with black constituents, but some community ministers and activists have complained that he has been slow to address their concerns.

headline.main: Black Leaders Showing Signs of Frustration With Mayor de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Black Leaders Showing Signs of Frustration With de Blasio

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio remains popular with black constituents, but some community ministers and activists have complained that he has been slow to address their concerns.
